text: Alicia Keys welcome to the 100 women
thank you what happened with you with
the decision that you had very publicly
to say I'm not going to wear makeup
anymore I was becoming very very overly
concerned with other people's opinions
of me to the point where I was you know
I would be freaked out because I was
leaving the house and didn't have makeup
on and I was just realizing that there
was just so much that so much that I had
that I had learned and that I think we
all learn as especially as women you
know and girls from the second that were
born from before we even come out you
know there's all of these images and
these expectations and all of these you
know particular pressures that are made
us to think this is what beauty is or
this is what a woman is or this is what
a successful woman is or this is what a
famous woman is or what do you think we
as women can do to push against that I
mean what should we be telling our
daughters I you know I just I'm one just
for a variety that's my thing
you know I just want myself and my
daughter if I had one and my son's you
know to see a variety of what people
look like here's what people look like
you know I mean and we look a vast array
of ways and it's really not not about
makeup or no makeup or anything like
that it's about what makes you
comfortable
and it's about also being able to
explore different versions of what makes
you comfortable and and seeing what
happened and you should be able to
without your dad your girlfriend your
boyfriend your husband saying like Shh
everybody don't quiet just give me a
second to have my own experience it's
all you regardless so and even for
myself when I want to wear makeup that's
my choice I can totally wear makeup and
no one should be able to say oh well
didn't you say you're never gonna like
no that's not what I was saying it's a
conversation you have on your new album
congratulations by the way here thank
you superb Lee written and performed by
yourself
thank you but one tracking
particulate stood up for me a girl can't
be herself it's a beautiful song and
everything that we're talking about now
there's bits of the lyric in that I'm
not going to do justice by saying it out
loud I'm wondering if I mean if I can
can you sing it for me
the chorus which is my favorite part
says when a girl can't be herself no
more I just want to cry I just want to
cry for the world when a girl can't be
herself no more I just want to cry I
just want to cry for the world it's so
beautiful it also is quite sad for me
why I give it thought that you can has
to be out there right that message has
to be given to go yeah it is sad
actually
it is sad that girls can't be themselves
it's sad that you know sad that through
this whole election process in America
that you know because Hillary was so
strong and clear and tough you know how
much unnecessary things were said about
her being a woman you know it's like we
as women we can be any way it can be
many ways and it is sad when you can't
be yourself you know whoever that self
is whatever it is and that's you know
that's a problem with girls all over the
world you know and there's so much
oppression for women and there's so much

and for women and it is sad we've gone
through one of the most bitterly for
elections in America's history you've
said in the past about Donald Trump that
you don't listen to anything that he
says and you said you don't care about
what he thinks about women it's going to
be your next president 45th President of
the United States of America
how do you feel about that I'm
disappointed I'm disappointed that such
so much hateful rhetoric and sexism and
bigotry and and and race racial slurs
and intolerance would be rewarded with a
presidency
Lygia Keys thank you for being part of a
